title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: An epic fantasy trilogy about the quest to destroy the One Ring and the battle against the Dark Lord Sauron.

author: George Orwell
summary: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about the dangers of totalitarianism.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
summary: A romantic novel that charts the emotional development of the protagonist, Elizabeth Bennet.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: A novel about the American dream and the roaring twenties, centered on the mysterious Jay Gatsby.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
summary: An epic tale of the voyage of the whaling ship Pequod and its captain, Ahab, who is obsessed with revenge on Moby Dick.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
summary: A historical novel that chronicles the French invasion of Russia and the impact of the Napoleonic era.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
summary: A story about teenage angst and alienation as experienced by the protagonist, Holden Caulfield.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: A fantasy novel that follows the quest of Bilbo Baggins to win a share of the treasure guarded by the dragon, Smaug.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
summary: The first book in the Harry Potter series, which introduces us to the young wizard Harry and his adventures at Hogwarts.
